Issue.creator: jsmitchell
Issue.summary: Design a mechanism for permissioned access to a network based on validator keys and on-chain config
Issue.description: Validators should be able to determine whether messages delivered to them should be handled or dropped based on a set of identities stored in the config namespace. Permissioning rules could determine the roles an identity is able to play on the network (e.g. connect, peer, publish blocks, forward blocks/batches). Message handlers should examine incoming messages against the permissioning rules and the current configuration and either permit, drop, or respond with an error to the sending node. In certain cases (e.g. attempting to peer without permission), it may make sense to forcibly close the connection.
